Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Coat! [throws coat at Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael just rented The Devil Wears Prada. He has his NetFlix sent here to the office, and he watches them in pieces when things are slow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Steak! Where's my steeaaak?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's a big Meryl Streep fan, so I shouldn't be surprised that he's identified with her character.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get me Armani.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A suit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Like the main company number? Because I'm gonna have to call information.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where's Armani? He's on the phone. Too slow. You are not going to Paris. I'm so much better than you are. [breaks into laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I owe you an apology.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You finished the movie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. It was awesome. Big surprise ending. Won't ruin it for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Meryl Streep is the bad guy. Never see it coming. Anyways, if I was mean in any way to you, I am sorry. I just want what's best for you, Mo Chuisle.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mo Chuisle. He's watching Million Dollar Baby... He's gonna try to kill me.

Quote.Speaker: Micahel
Quote.Text: So this one goes with my eyes and this one goes with your eyes. People have said I have very pretty eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I haven't heard the same about you. So let's just go with mine.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, they both go with the carpet I've ordered, and if you go with the brown leather on the sofas, then they go with that too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We already have a sofa. So why do--

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: A futon's not a sofa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It... folds up. You've only seen it flat.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I know what a futon is, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I-- Ok. How much is this going to cost?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It costs what it costs.

Quote.Speaker: Michae
Quote.Text: No-- don't... that doesn't even mean anything.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We have gone through this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Money has been a little tight lately. But, at the end of my life, when I'm sitting on my yacht, am I gonna be thinking about how much money I have? No. I'm going to be thinking about how many friends I have, and my children, and my comedy albums. I mean, I have a yacht, so I obviously did pretty well money wise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's just that you say it's gonna cost what it costs-- [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Michael, it's Ryan for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Conniving little runt. Put him through.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Put him through. Yes. Ryan, my man!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [on the phone] I sent you an email about the new Powerpoint.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, and thank you for sending that to me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I had IT install the updated Powerpoint on the computer so you can use it for the presentation. I really want people there using Powerpoint.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, yeah, I dunno. I dunno, I think those IT guys messed up.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hold on, I'll get them on the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looking at nothing] Wait, oh, no, here it is, here it is. Found it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [talking on phone] Sure, I can hold.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [picks up phone] Dunder Mifflin, Dwight Schrute. Please hold. [opens book, then picks up phone] Schrute Farms, guten tag. How can I help you? Yes, we have availability on those nights. How many in your party? Oh no, I'm sorry, no king beds. No queen either. Well, we make our own mattresses that don't conform to the traditional sizes. Closest would be twin. Thank you so much for calling. Call back again. Aufedersein!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: None of your business, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you run the bed and breakfest?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is not a B and B.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Agrotourism is a lot more than a bed and breakfest. It consists of tourists coming to a farm, showing them around, giving them a bed, giving them brekafest.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Does the Department of Health know about this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not telling you anything. [lookings into the camera] Permits are pending. [phone rings] Dwight Schrute, Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello, I'm looking for a room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, this is a mis-use of company phones.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It says here you cater to the eldery.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where did you read that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Trip Advsior.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Trip Advisor is the life blood of the Agrotourism industry. A couple of bad reviews there, you might as well close up shop. That's what took down the Stalk Inn. One of the cutest little asparagus farms you'll ever see.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How many in your party?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Two?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We offer tours of the fields, and of the barn. Uh, perhaps you'll be interested in, um, Mose's table making demonstration?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So, um, I forgot to tell you that I need the car tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Um, actually, I need the car.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why? Improv? Why don't you just pretend you have a car? Good practice, incase you ever do a scene where you need to pretend you have a car?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Use to have two cars, traded 'em in, now we're down to one. Good economic sense. Although the new car is a Porsche. For her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One cardigan, one sleeping cardigan and one sleep apnea mask.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What about my cherub figurine?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You took that with you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No I left it on my night table-- your night table, by the lamp.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are incorrect. I was recently scrubbing my room of memories, and I didn't see it there.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My girlfriend and I broke up recently. And I must say, I am relieved. Gives me a chance to sow my wild oats. In the Schrute family, we have a tradition, where when the male has sex with another woman, he is rewarded with a bag of wild oats left on his door step by his parents. You can use these oats to make oatmeal, bread, whatever you want. I don't care, they're your oats.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The bar uses an applause meter. That is why it's so important that you all come and applaud only for my band. Scrantonicity 2. NOT Scrantonicity, which I am no longer a part of. Michael, can I count on you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can not, I have a thing tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dammit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That reminds me, uh, if the invitation still stands, Pam and I would love to have dinner tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh no, I have a thing tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Darn it!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shoot!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How about this weekend?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, can't.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We only had tonight free, and we really wanted to spend it with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dammit to hell. I-I-ugh, ok. All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where are you going out tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You wouldn't understand. It's a secret.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I wouldn't understand or a secret?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You wouldn't understand, Jim. It's a secret.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry Mr. O'Brian, I didn't mean to interrupt your dinner. I just have a very exciting offer. My records indicate that you have expressed interest in losing some weight. Well, what if I told you that I have a pill that will make you 50 pounds lighter in 5 minutes? How does that sound? Amazing right? Well, it won't be that fast, but it will-[notices camera]- it will be that easy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't believe this place is real. I mean, I've heard about his beet farm for years, but wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The Beets Motel.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The Beets Motel? That is, wow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. Eh. The Embassy Beets. Radishon!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How are you doing this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know! [Mose starts running by the left side of the car]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my gosh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just love sales. I love it to death. It's as simple as that. And I don't get to do it enough as a manager, so I took this second job. I count it as a hobby. Some people have golf, or relaxing.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: What's going on here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, I just got off the phone, and I was gonna make another call.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: We're a legit operation with a license from the city I can show you. We pay minimum wage against commision--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, they're with me, so... this is Nick Figaro, manager to the stars!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We have three rooms, each with a different theme.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are the themes?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: American, Irrigation, and Night-Time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Irrigation.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll put you down for Irrigation. Well then, do you have any special needs or diertary restrictions?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. We will be requiring a bed time story.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not even Harry Potter?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Jim, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: But you promised.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mose, bags! Now!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here we are, the Irrigation Room! A very special room. So I'll come get you before the table-making demonstration. And as of this morning, we are completely wireless here in Schrute Farms. But as soon as I find out where Mose hid all the wires, we'll get that power back on. All righty.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Everybody in the conference room. In 5 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: These meetings are useless.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: I just want to remind you to stick to the script. Improving the work. So, make the call, say the lines, make the sale. Got it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very inspirational. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: We're offering a $50 bonus tonight to the guy with the most sales. Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Co-Worker 1
Quote.Text: Or a woman.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Or a trained seal. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: You could make jokes when you've made a sale there rookie, ok? [laughter ends]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmmm, I'd say 1 in 6.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I thought you asked me what our chances were in being murdered here tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, I've just realized, this is Pam's and my first night away together. I use to play it over my head, and it was just a little bit different. Maybe a uh, nice hotel. Or a romantic dinner. Wine... uh but, wine that wasn't made out of beets. Didn't think Dwight would be involved at all. And uh, I always imagined less manure. I mean, some manure, just... less.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mose, what are you doing? No Mose! Put the-- Put the manure down! Put it down! Do not throw it! DO NOT THROW IT! Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, is Mr. Hudson there?

Quote.Speaker: Stanely
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Yes, who is this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just calling because you responded positively to the--

Quote.Speaker: Stanely
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why are you calling me here at home?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Spanish accent] Senor, are you happy with your--

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Michael, I know that's you. Why are you calling me here at home?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [speaking with a different voice] Have you-- Have you considered satellite television?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Michael, I know that's you. I know your voice. Why are you calling me here at home? [Michael hands up]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [on the phone] When I'm at home at night in my own house in my sweats drinking some red wine watching my mystery stories, the last thing in the whole God forsaken world I want to hear is the voice of Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well your son sounds like he's really motivated. I think it's crazy the coach won't play him frankly.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: [hangs up phone] My office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You bet.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Just dial the number on the sheet and stick to the script. Say those words exactly, got it? I don't know why we have to keep on having this conversation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, I know sales, and I had that sale, I just needed a few more minutes--

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: A few more minutes is a waste of our time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is not a waste of our time.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: This is a trading game.

Quote.Speaker: Micael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: You give a quick pitch. You make the sale. You move on. That's how Vikram does it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Vikram doesn't have my people skills.

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: Good for Vikram, because he out-sells you every night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I hope this conversation has helped.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [reading to Jim, Pam, and Mose] And Harry saw the white hand raise its wand, and felt Voldemort's surge of vicious anger. Saw the frail old man on the floor write in agony. "Harry?" It was over quickly as it had come. Harry stood shaking in the darkness, clutching the gate in the garden, his heart racing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What did you get tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Oh it looks like mixed masala, eggplant, and rice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that looks good.

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Oh, and what about you? Peanut butter flavor again?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going with the vanilla crisp this evening.

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Enjoy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: I was a surgeon back home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wonder what I would've been back home?

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Well this is your home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, but it's competitive here. What's a dollar worth in your land? Medical school must cost like 40 bucks or a donkey or something.

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Uhh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would've been chief of surgery... Or a cowboy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim and Pam hear noise] Wait, you're going up there?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Coward.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam sees Mose in an outhouse] Oh my God. What century is this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, here's the thing about Die Hard 4. Die Hard one, the original, John McClane was just this normal guy. You know, he's just a normal New York City cop, who gets his feet cut, and gets beat up. But he's an everyday guy. In Die Hard 4, he is jumping a motorcycle into a helicopter. In air. You know? He's invincible. It just sort of lost what Die Hard was. It's not Terminator.

Quote.Speaker: Co-Worker 2
Quote.Text: Dude, you should review movies. [other co-workers agree]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I actually wrote a movie.

Quote.Speaker: Co-Worker 3
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm writing one, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Co-Worker 3
Quote.Text: What's it about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, sort of a spy, thriller...

Quote.Speaker: Nick
Quote.Text: What's so captivating? [everyone stops talking, go back to work] I like captivating things. And this must be really captivating because it's keeping you off the phones. I mean time is your money, that's how I know how captivating it is. Because how much time you spend talking.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam and Jim hear Dwight crying] Ugh, your turn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Jim knocks on Dwight's door, crying stops] Come in. Did you have another nightmare?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, Jim. I thought you were Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Does Mose have nightmares?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh yes. Ever since the storm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is everything satisfactory with your stay?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just thought that I heard crying, moaning, or something in here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. Well I'll look into that in the morning. Thank you for bringing that to the attention of the staff.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good night, Dwight. [Jim leaves, Dwight continues crying]

Quote.Speaker: Co-Worker 2
Quote.Text: Yeah, so we're all gonna go out for a beer. Do you wanna come?

Quote.Speaker: Co-Worker 3
Quote.Text: We'd love for you to come, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks, no, I have work tomorrow morning.

Quote.Speaker: Co-Worker 2
Quote.Text: All right, next time dude.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, see you guys. [Sees Jan] Hey, how you doin'?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You drive, I had too much wine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. How's yoga?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I didn't go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wh-Why not?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I just didn't!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: How was improv?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good night Vikram.

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, congrats on the bonus.

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Thank you Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm gonna have it one of these nights.

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Well if you concentrate and make your calls faster, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Vikram
Quote.Text: Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael. Morning. Hey Dwight, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am better than you have ever been or ever will be. [Ryan walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey guys! What's happening? How's my favorite branch doin'?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael, why dont you start us off?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... that wasn't much of an introduction.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, your boss, Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh, still lame. Okay. All right. Thank you, Ryan, for that wonderful introduction. Okay, um, today we're gonna be talking... about...PowerPoint! PowerPoint! PowerPoint! PowerPoint!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes I forgot about Ryan's presentation. And yes, it would have been nice to do well with the first presentation he had given me. But you know what else would have been nice? Winning the lottery.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And the best way to start is to hit start. And up comes the toolbar, that's what she said. What we have to do here is go to Run, and then you look up to PowerPoint. And we are in. We are going to register. You hit register-- Updates are ready. I should update. Um, estimated time 12 minutes, so this should take 5 or 10 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is this the first time you ever opened PowerPoint?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You didn't prepare a presentation at all, did you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I had a really rough night, and my boss can back you up on that.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm your boss.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My other boss, Mr. Figaro.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You have another job?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What I do between 5:30 pm and 1 am is no one's business but mine and my other business'.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you a cocktail waitress?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You can not have another job if it affects your work here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It won't.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It did, all ready.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, honestly, it was unlikely I was gonna figure this out anyways. [Kelly laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You're so funny.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why is Darryl here? He works in the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I invited him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's not a party. Darryl, back downstairs, this isn't information you need.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: There's information here? Yeah, you're right, I don't need this.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Okay. [makes out with Darryl]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, get off.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Umm, see you later tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I have plans later.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Okay, bye honey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How long until you actually get this presentation ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you do the presentation, because you know how to do it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know what I really want? Honestly Michael, is for you to know it, so you can communicate to the people here, to your clients, to whomever.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's whoever, not whomever.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, it's whomever.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, whomever is never actually right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, sometimes its right.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Michael is right. It's a made-up word used to trick students.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Actually, whomever is the formal version of the word.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Obviously it's a real word, but I don't know when to use it correctly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not a native speaker.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I know what's right, but I'm not gonna say, because you're all jerks who didn't come see my band last night.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Do you really know which one is correct?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's 'whom' when it's the object of a sentence, and 'who' when it's the subject.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, that sounds right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well it sounds right, but is it?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How did Ryan use it? As an object?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: As an object.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ryan used me an object.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is he right about that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How did he use it again?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It was Ryan wanted Michael, the subject, to explain the computer system, the object.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: To whomever, meaning us, the indirect object. Which is the correct usage of the word.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No one, uh, asked you anything ever, so whomever's name is Toby, why don't you take a letter opener and stick it into your skull.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Wait! This doesn't matter. And I don't even care. Michael, you quit the other job, or you're fired here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've never done this before. I've never quit anything in my life. So, you are filming history.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nick, I had a dream last night that I had two full time jobs. One here at the Lipophedrazone diet pill company--

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Figaro
Quote.Text: Lipophedrine

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And the other I was a Regional Manager of a small paper supply company called Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Figaro
Quote.Text: Never heard of it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In this dream I did both of these jobs beautifully, and I loved it, and everybody loved me. But the truth is, I can't do this.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Figaro
Quote.Text: Are you quitting?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Figaro
Quote.Text: Come back anytime, don't forget to disinfect your headset.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was never in this for the money. But it turns out that the money was an absolute necessity for me. I tried to live the dream. I tried to have a job, a girlfriend, another job, and I failed. But the good thing about the American dream is that you can just go to sleep, and try it all again the next night.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Me. All night. Dreaming about Angela's smoking hot body.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're being gross.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not from a male perspective. You need to set me up with her, I know she told you that she's looking, and she's totally not responding to my moves.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What moves?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I have moon-walked past accounting like ten times.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't believe that's not working.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I don't know if I really see you two together.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really? Well, maybe you should look in the smart part of your brain.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's very religious.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, well I come from a line Wasps so long it leads back to Moses.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, well she takes her convictions pretty seriously, she can be kind of severe.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, and I punched a hole in a wall.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's right, you did.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Now that I think about it, Angela and Andy might actually make a good couple. But I couldn't do that to Dwight... or Angela... or Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Kevin, you're a gambler right? A rounder, you play the ponies, small horses.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I do gamble Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I was thinking about doing some gambling myself. You know, just a little bit of money. Maybe doubling it, and them doubling it seven more times. I don't know, kind of just for fun. I was thinking, do you have tips, or ideas about sure things. Like a boxer who is going to throw the big fight, you know, like, like he's tied into some crooked dealings, maybe his kid is sick or something. Like, who do I call about that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The mob.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you know anybody in the mob?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [shakes head no]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, um, Oscar, I'm going to need to take another advance on my salary.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What do you mean you have plans tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I have my daughter tonight; we're renting Charlotte's Web.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, you have to make a choice, it's either your daughter, or me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: My daughter.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Okay, I see how it is. [pushes a stack of files onto the floor] Oops.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That was cold.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [makes a W then an L with her fingers, and then runs a finger across her throat]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He's always been terrible with money.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I bet it's Jan spending him straight to the poor house.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, women be shoppin'.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I can't believe he has a second job.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He's not even good at his first one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What'cha talking about? [camera pans to each face in the break room] Okay, I know what's going on. You're talking about Jim and Pam, if they're having sex, what it looks like, I know, I think--

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, are you having money problems?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Monkey problem? No, I'm not having monkey problems. Why would I have monkey problems?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You heard me correctly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I hate monkeys.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's going on, why do you have a second job?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't have a second job. Maybe I'm having an affair with Suzanne Summers.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Doesn't Jan have money?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't talk to my girlfriend about money. It is rude, and unsexual.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: True, it's best to hide our money problems from women.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I totally agree with you. But I don't have money problems, I don't. Alright, you know what? Watch this, if I had money problems, would I do this? [Michael holds up a bill, crumples it up, puts it back in his pocket]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar and Stanley
Quote.Text: You just put it back in your pocket.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I destroyed it, it's not even useable anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, let's call this what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's like she only wants to hook up when Ryan comes around. It's gotten to the point where I get excited every time I see that little dude walk through the door.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, I just need to know where this is going.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, I like you. Oh yeah, what's not to like? But you need to access your uncrazy side, otherwise maybe this thing's run its course.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Don't you dare walk away from me Darryl Philben, you are the most selfish person I've ever met in my entire--

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Slow down, think it over.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Darryl Philben is the most complicated man that I've ever met. I mean, who says exactly what they're thinking? What kind of game is that?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey cuz, heard you're having money problems.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No you didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Listen, I've got the answer. You declare bankruptcy, all your problems go away.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Creed Bratton has never declared bankruptcy. When Creed Bratton gets in trouble, he transfers his debt to William Charles Schneider.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How would that help Creed? In Monopoly when you go bankrupt, you lose.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You don't go by Monopoly man, that game is nuts. Nobody just picks up "get out of jail free" cards, those things cost thousands.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is a good point.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Bankruptcy, Michael, is nature's do-over. It's a fresh start, it's a clean slate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like the witness protection program.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Not at all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've always wanted to be in the witness protection program. Fresh start, no debts, no baggage. I've already got my name picked out, Lord Rupert Everton. I'm a shipping merchant who raises fancy dogs. That's the life.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... DECLARE... BANKRUPTCY!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, I just wanted you to know that you can't just say the word bankruptcy and expect anything to happen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't say it, I declared it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Still, that's not anything.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This is a lot of credit card debt.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, tell me about it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, Jan has my credit cards, and she's using them as if I'm made of money, she thinks I'm a human ATM machine.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, a hundred and twenty-five dollars, Amazon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that's the Muppet Show, on DVD, classic.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Twelve hundred dollars. What's a Core Blaster Extreme?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is by far the best way to strengthen your core. This machine, you sit on a stabilizer ball, you put your feet into the power stir-ups, you reach up and you grab onto the super rod, and you twist, and you twist, and you twist. It strengthens your entire core. Your back core, your arm core, the Marine Core actually uses it. I think that's how they got a core.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I left a little present for Angela. I think she's going to like it, because I found it outside of Vance Refrigeration all alone, and I told her in the note that the cat came to find her, that they were destined to be together. I got game.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, the green bar is what you spend every month on stuff you need, like a car and a house.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hm. That is so cool how you have my name at the top.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The red bar is what you spend on non-essentials, like magazines, entertainment, things like that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This scary black bar is what you spend on things that no one ever, ever needs, like multiple magic sets, professional bass fishing equipment.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do they do this so fast? Is this power-point?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Man, Angela really had a hold on him. [Dwight playing the recorder in the background] Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm going to set you and Jan up with a debt consolidator, you meet with this guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, we are going to leave Jan out of this.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She has to know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We will find another way, we'll ask power-point.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, this is a presentation tool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're a presentation tool if you think I'm gonna tell Jan about this.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm done!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No you're not! Ok, just... you're not a tool. Look, we'll tell her that it's bad, but it could've been a lot worse but due to some fancy financial foot work I was able to cut it in half.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Jan is smart.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: She poses.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, how's the hotel business?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Have you checked Trip Advisor recently?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe you should.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe you should. Whatever.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We wrote a good review. Under comments, we wrote, the natural aroma of the beets drifts into the bedroom and makes you dream of simpler times.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The dawn goose walk will tug at your heartstrings.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Table making never seemed so possible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You will never want to leave your room.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The architecture reminds one of a quaint Tuscan beet farm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm glad you enjoyed your stay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We really did. It was fun.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So due to Michael's clever financial maneuvering, he finds himself tremendously in debt.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] You're broke?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, that's, how did you get that from what Oscar's saying?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] Michael, how did this happen? Where did all your money go? I don't, I don't get this. I really don't. I don't know how you could be so irresponsible. I mean, this is, it is astounding to me, really. I don't know what more to say.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yeah, what?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael left.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] Okay, where did he go?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] Well, is he coming right back?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on phone] I'll be right there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What am I doing? I am blowing dodge. I'm getting out of town. Whatever you call it, I am running away from my responsibilities. And it feels good.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [to Andy] You may ask me out to dinner. Nothing fancy or foreign, no bars, no patios, no vegetables, and no seafood.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uhh-mmm [moaning]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did I ever tell you why I left Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [incoherent mumbling] No you didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I didn't think I had. Well, it was all about Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm-uh-mm [incoherent mumbling]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean she was with Roy, and, uh, I just couldn't take it. I mean, I lost it Dwight. I couldn't sleep, I couldn't concentrate on anything. Even weird stuff, like food had no taste. So my solution was to move away. It was awful. It was something that I wouldn't wish on my worst enemy, and that includes you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sobbing, reaches out to Jim after he walked away]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, I was thinking about dinner-- [Jim grabs her face and kisses her]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, dinner. Let's see, maybe we should try the new Italian place, where the drive-in used to be.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim's just really passionate about Italian food.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yep, I'm very passionate about Italian food. In fact, um, I'm in love with Italian food.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Jan, he went running that way.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Alright. [throws her keys at Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Runaway train, never come back. Runaway and I'm never coming back.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not much, what's up with you?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, why are you sitting on a train? Where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm out of answers Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I told you, no more answers. This is who I am now. A guy on a train with no answers. I hope that can be enough for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, come on. Running away from your problems won't solve anything. You know that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know that.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Your creditors can follow you anywhere with ease. Your debt follows you around the world, electronically.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll stay off the grid.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, Michael, come on, come on, you can deal with this. It's not that bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah it is, it is. I really messed up.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, when my life fell apart and they, and they screwed me in New York, and I felt like my whole world was collapsing around me, I didn't have anyone. I mean, my whole family still won't even talk to me, on the advice of counsel, and my friends were just waiting for this to happen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's really nice of you to say.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, no, what I want to say is you were there for me. By my side. Without even a thought. That's just who you are. I mean, no matter how badly I treat you, or what I'm going through, you just, you are there for me. And that is a guy worth staying beside. So, where's this train taking us?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think the engineer left.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [takes a ruler and shoves it between his desk and Jim's, knocking Jim's files on the floor] Hello, this is Dwight Schrute calling from Dunder-Mifflin, and according to our records you appear to be low on office supplies. Okay, sure, yeah I can take care of that right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't sell your implants please.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm keeping them. I know you like them. They're kind of uncomfortable though.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's nice though.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It's kind of painful and my nipples are over-sensitive now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It looks cute though.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I used to get offers in the mail for credit cards all the time. They would say things like "don't pay for six months" or "you can transfer your account from another card"...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, [mumbling] I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you think I'll get any new ones? I could... [pause, eventually looks up at Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you mean, "what"?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What... [mumbling]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Were you listening to what I was saying?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was aware that you were speaking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is the matter with you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is the matter with... me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm... discombobulated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need help.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, well, go find some. Get outa here, please. [Dwight sighs and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, you need to focus, Michael. You need to stop spending money.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I hate to ask you this, but are there any retirement funds you can borrow from?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, my CDs.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You have CDs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, good, okay. What bank?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My CDs are in a portfolio, a rather large portfolio, um, called Case Logic

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [whispers] Case Logic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And, um the Case Logic portfolio is currently in the back seat of my car. There is another smaller Case Logic portfolio clipped to my visor [Oscar vigorously shakes his head] What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm asking about Certificates of Deposit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've been putting money into CDs for years. I bought music that I didn't even like. No. [shakes head]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I just think that...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't go back to that.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I think you can. I... what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know if I can do that. I can't see myself spending the next six years digging myself out of that kind of hole.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: All right, well then maybe there's another way, you know? I mean, we could just... we'll think of something else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We will? I can't. I don't have an idea in my head.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well... well, we will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We just will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. What? Um...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I have some ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [laughs] I am not going to tell you yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, please? I won't tell anybody.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, yes, you will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I will.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Gentlemen, a word. Look, you guys are my closest friends in this office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right back at ya.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And as such, I come to you...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: State your business!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am dying of lovesickness and horny-sickness.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is impossible. Unless you mean gonorrhea.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm talking about Angela, okay? Did you hear what she was saying to Pam the other day?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, I did, 'cept I don't think she means it. Angela is in a great deal of pain because of the death of her cat, and she's in a kind of a grieving process, and it makes her say things. So... best to just lay off.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No can do. I am itching all over with Angela-pox.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God, you do have gonorrhea.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy! Maybe this is one of those situations where you just have to do her to get her out of your system.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stay out of this, you!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, fellas! And... lady.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I still do not have your reimbursement check.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's not why I came over. I mean it's a week late, but... I just came over to say hi.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [waves] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Angela, you like lacrosse?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Lacrosse, the sport?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Scranton U. Varsity's gonna scrimmage the J.V. squad. Should be pretty interesting. J.V. gets really amped.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I guess it's a big opportunity for them.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You wanna go?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Because we could get some food...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Afterwards at the...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Andy, no. [Andy nods and starts backing away, Kevin giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Still waiting on that check.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam! You don't think he'll mind if we take the shampoo, do you? [holds up large bottle]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm. Mmm-mmm. [shakes head 'no']

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Mose serves bacon] Thank you, Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Everybody poops.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, they do.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: There's no other... way to get rid of the food.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where's Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Gone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Where'd he go?

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: His day place.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The office.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: What office?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mose, Angela hasn't been around here much lately, has she?

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela - she used to stay here sometimes?

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Angela [leaves].

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: [on trampoline] Cannonball! Lemon bomb! Jim, Pam, watch! Jim, Pam, watch! Jim, Pam, watch!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, we're watching, Mose!

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Okay, go Yankees! I'm a war hero!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're doin' great, buddy!

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Name's Mose, buddy! Dwight, can I stop? They're not even looking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, go ahead and stop. You guys, you should really be looking, he's working his ass off over here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, did we or did we not pay for a show?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, go ahead, they're right.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Large spins!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [not watching Mose] More spins.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Arr, dammit! [throws saw at table he was working on]

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Helicopter!
